name: Milwaukee Bucks
history: Founded in 1968, the Bucks secured their first NBA title in just their third season (1971) led by a young Lew Alcindor and Oscar Robertson. The franchise has remained in Milwaukee, moving to the state-of-the-art Fiserv Forum in 2018 to revitalize the city's downtown. After a 50-year wait, they captured a second championship in 2021 behind the historic performance of Giannis Antetokounmpo. The Bucks are defined by a 'Fear the Deer' mentality and a tradition of elite big men that spans from the franchise's inception to the present day.
fun_facts: The franchise was awarded to Milwaukee in 1968, and the name 'Bucks' was chosen from over 14,000 fan entries.
Giannis Antetokounmpo scored 50 points in the championship-clinching Game 6 of the 2021 NBA Finals.
They won a coin flip against the Phoenix Suns in 1969 for the right to draft Lew Alcindor (Kareem Abdul-Jabbar).
Their 1970s court at the MECCA arena was designed by pop artist Robert Indiana and is considered a piece of art.
They are the fastest expansion team in North American sports history to win a championship (3 seasons).
